intro: Lachemilla llanganatensis, commonly known as the Llanganate lichen, is a rare and unique plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and has adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its habitat. Its botanical features include small, clustered leaves and flowers that are often hidden beneath a dense mat of foliage. Due to its limited distribution and specialized environment, it is considered a valuable subject for ecological and botanical study.
